title: Terrorism major threat to Pakistan’s stability: Dr Moeed
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 30 (APP):National Security Adviser (NSA) Dr Moeed Yusuf on Thursday said terrorism was a major threat to Pakistan’s stability, as Post-9/11 policies in Afghanistan had led to terrorism in the country.
The NSA was addressing the special session of the Islamabad Security Dialogue held here at NUST University on the situation in Afghanistan, said a media release.
NSA Dr Moeed Yusuf during his address presented a historical perspective on Afghanistan issue.He underscored that the world should learn from the mistakes of the past.
“Pakistan has always strived for peace and stability in Afghanistan and there are no two opinions on this,” Dr Moeed Yusuf said. He vowed that Pakistan wanted a stable Afghanistan.
Meanwhile, Moeed Yusuf in a post said it was a pleasure to have a very candid and insightful conversation with the students at NUST during the Islamabad Security Dialogue’s special session on Afghanistan.
The National Security Advisor said he thought that he should share his concluding message to the students as well.
In his twitter post, Moeed Yusuf also shared the audio clip of his concluding remarks
